description: telephone in the shape of an airplane; top half orange; bottom half dark orange; dial at front with clear plastic "propeller" circle surrounding it; dark orange cord; hand-set rests in cradle at "back" of plane
text: In the '70s and '80s, novelty telephones became the craze.  Catering to a younger generation becoming increasingly hooked on telephones, manufacturers added frivolity and personality to the necessity of the telephone.  Many models were produced in the form of cartoon characters.  This phone, named after Alexander Graham Bell who invented the telephone in 1876, was cleverly modeled into an airplane - a telephone flight of fancy.
title: "Alexander Graham" airplane rotary-dial telephone
